title: Executive Order 5134-Authorizing the Appointment of Mary V. Kehoe Without Regard to Civil Service Rules
content: Mrs. Mary V. Kehoe may be appointed to an appropriate position in the General Accounting Office without regard to the examination requirements of the civil service rules. She is the widow of George D. Kehoe, who died February 9, 1929, after many years of honorable and faithful service in the Government Printing Office, Treasury Department, and General Accounting Office.
This order is recommended by the Comptroller General.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5134-Authorizing the Appointment of Mary V. Kehoe Without Regard to Civil Service Rules Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360834
